meanings.definition: A division or section of a poem or song.
meanings.sent1: The poet read a fytte from his new poem at the event.
meanings.sent2: The singer performed the final fytte of the song with great emotion.
meanings.sent3: During the concert, the audience requested an encore of the first fytte.
meanings.sent4: The fytte of emotions in the poem resonated deeply with the listeners.
meanings.sent5: The fytte painted a vivid picture of nature's beauty in the song.

meanings.definition: To divide or separate into sections.
meanings.sent1: She will fytte the document into smaller parts for easier reading.
meanings.sent2: The chef will fytte the ingredients before starting the recipe.
meanings.sent3: He decided to fytte his time between work and hobbies more efficiently.
meanings.sent4: The river seemed to fytte the land as it meandered through the valley.
meanings.sent5: The teacher will fytte the class into groups for the project.
